alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 01 at 4:56AM EDT until November 01 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Lake effect snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Southern Erie county. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow continues with snowfall rates of up to an inch per hour possible this morning. The highest snowfall accumulations will be expected south of I-90, where temperatures will be cold enough to sustain snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
